meanings.definition: A branch or lateral shoot from a main stem or trunk.
meanings.sent1: The tree had many offshoots growing from its main trunk.
meanings.sent2: The gardener pruned the offshoots to help the tree grow stronger.
meanings.sent3: The offshoots seemed to be playing a game of hide-and-seek with the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The offshoots of creativity blossomed into a beautiful garden of ideas.
meanings.sent5: The offshoots swayed gently in the breeze, like dancers in a ballet.

meanings.definition: A secondary or derivative product or result.
meanings.sent1: The new software was an offshoot of the original program.
meanings.sent2: The success of the movie led to many offshoots, including merchandise and sequels.
meanings.sent3: The offshoots of the experiment surprised even the scientists involved.
meanings.sent4: Her offshoots of thought often led to unexpected and exciting discoveries.
meanings.sent5: The offshoots of her hard work were evident in the growth of her business.
